title: arangolint
description: Opinionated best practices for arangodb client.

title: asasalint
description: Check for pass []any as any in variadic func(...any).

title: asciicheck
description: Checks that all code identifiers does not have non-ASCII symbols in the name.

title: bidichk
description: Checks for dangerous unicode character sequences.

title: bodyclose
description: Checks whether HTTP response body is closed successfully.

title: canonicalheader
description: Canonicalheader checks whether net/http.Header uses canonical header.

title: containedctx
description: Containedctx is a linter that detects struct contained context.Context field.

title: contextcheck
description: Check whether the function uses a non-inherited context.

title: copyloopvar
description: A linter detects places where loop variables are copied.

title: cyclop
description: Checks function and package cyclomatic complexity.

title: decorder
description: Check declaration order and count of types, constants, variables and functions.

title: depguard
description: Go linter that checks if package imports are in a list of acceptable packages.

title: dogsled
description: Checks assignments with too many blank identifiers (e.g. x, _, _, _, := f()).

title: dupl
description: Detects duplicate fragments of code.

title: dupword
description: Checks for duplicate words in the source code.

title: durationcheck
description: Check for two durations multiplied together.

title: embeddedstructfieldcheck
description: Embedded types should be at the top of the field list of a struct, and there must be an empty line separating embedded fields from regular fields.

title: err113
description: Check errors handling expressions.

title: errcheck
description: Errcheck is a program for checking for unchecked errors in Go code. These unchecked errors can be critical bugs in some cases.

title: errchkjson
description: Checks types passed to the json encoding functions. Reports unsupported types and reports occurrences where the check for the returned error can be omitted.

title: errname
description: Checks that sentinel errors are prefixed with the `Err` and error types are suffixed with the `Error`.

title: errorlint
description: Find code that can cause problems with the error wrapping scheme introduced in Go 1.13.

title: exhaustive
description: Check exhaustiveness of enum switch statements.

title: exhaustruct
description: Checks if all structure fields are initialized.

title: exptostd
description: Detects functions from golang.org/x/exp/ that can be replaced by std functions.

title: fatcontext
description: Detects nested contexts in loops and function literals.

title: forbidigo
description: Forbids identifiers.

title: forcetypeassert
description: Find forced type assertions.

title: funcorder
description: Checks the order of functions, methods, and constructors.

title: funlen
description: Checks for long functions.

title: ginkgolinter
description: Enforces standards of using ginkgo and gomega.

title: gocheckcompilerdirectives
description: Checks that go compiler directive comments (//go:) are valid.

title: gochecknoglobals
description: Check that no global variables exist.

title: gochecknoinits
description: Checks that no init functions are present in Go code.

title: gochecksumtype
description: Run exhaustiveness checks on Go "sum types".

title: gocognit
description: Computes and checks the cognitive complexity of functions.

title: goconst
description: Finds repeated strings that could be replaced by a constant.

title: gocritic
description: Provides diagnostics that check for bugs, performance and style issues.

title: gocyclo
description: Computes and checks the cyclomatic complexity of functions.

title: godoclint
description: Checks Golang's documentation practice (godoc).

title: godot
description: Check if comments end in a period.

title: godox
description: Detects usage of FIXME, TODO and other keywords inside comments.

title: goheader
description: Check if file header matches to pattern.

title: gomoddirectives
description: Manage the use of 'replace', 'retract', and 'excludes' directives in go.mod.

title: gomodguard
description: Allow and blocklist linter for direct Go module dependencies. This is different from depguard where there are different block types for example version constraints and module recommendations.

title: goprintffuncname
description: Checks that printf-like functions are named with `f` at the end.

title: gosec
description: Inspects source code for security problems.

title: gosmopolitan
description: Report certain i18n/l10n anti-patterns in your Go codebase.

title: govet
description: Vet examines Go source code and reports suspicious constructs. It is roughly the same as 'go vet' and uses its passes.

title: grouper
description: Analyze expression groups.

title: iface
description: Detect the incorrect use of interfaces, helping developers avoid interface pollution.

title: importas
description: Enforces consistent import aliases.

title: inamedparam
description: Reports interfaces with unnamed method parameters.

title: ineffassign
description: Detects when assignments to existing variables are not used.

title: interfacebloat
description: A linter that checks the number of methods inside an interface.

title: intrange
description: Intrange is a linter to find places where for loops could make use of an integer range.

title: iotamixing
description: Checks if iotas are being used in const blocks with other non-iota declarations.

title: ireturn
description: Accept Interfaces, Return Concrete Types.

title: lll
description: Reports long lines.

title: loggercheck
description: Checks key value pairs for common logger libraries (kitlog,klog,logr,slog,zap).

title: maintidx
description: Maintidx measures the maintainability index of each function.

title: makezero
description: Find slice declarations with non-zero initial length.

title: mirror
description: Reports wrong mirror patterns of bytes/strings usage.

title: misspell
description: Finds commonly misspelled English words.

title: mnd
description: An analyzer to detect magic numbers.

title: modernize
description: A suite of analyzers that suggest simplifications to Go code, using modern language and library features.

title: musttag
description: Enforce field tags in (un)marshaled structs.

title: nakedret
description: Checks that functions with naked returns are not longer than a maximum size (can be zero).

title: nestif
description: Reports deeply nested if statements.

title: nilerr
description: Find the code that returns nil even if it checks that the error is not nil.

title: nilnesserr
description: Reports constructs that checks for err != nil, but returns a different nil value error.

title: nilnil
description: Checks that there is no simultaneous return of `nil` error and an invalid value.

title: nlreturn
description: Checks for a new line before return and branch statements to increase code clarity.

title: noctx
description: Detects function and method with missing usage of context.Context.

title: noinlineerr
description: Disallows inline error handling (`if err := ...; err != nil {`).

title: nolintlint
description: Reports ill-formed or insufficient nolint directives.

title: nonamedreturns
description: Reports all named returns.

title: nosprintfhostport
description: Checks for misuse of Sprintf to construct a host with port in a URL.

title: paralleltest
description: Detects missing usage of t.Parallel() method in your Go test.

title: perfsprint
description: Checks that fmt.Sprintf can be replaced with a faster alternative.

title: prealloc
description: Find slice declarations that could potentially be pre-allocated.

title: predeclared
description: Find code that shadows one of Go's predeclared identifiers.

title: promlinter
description: Check Prometheus metrics naming via promlint.

title: protogetter
description: Reports direct reads from proto message fields when getters should be used.

title: reassign
description: Checks that package variables are not reassigned.

title: recvcheck
description: Checks for receiver type consistency.

title: revive
description: Fast, configurable, extensible, flexible, and beautiful linter for Go. Drop-in replacement of golint.

title: rowserrcheck
description: Checks whether Rows.Err of rows is checked successfully.

title: sloglint
description: Ensure consistent code style when using log/slog.

title: spancheck
description: Checks for mistakes with OpenTelemetry/Census spans.

title: sqlclosecheck
description: Checks that sql.Rows, sql.Stmt, sqlx.NamedStmt, pgx.Query are closed.

title: staticcheck
description: It's the set of rules from staticcheck.

title: tagalign
description: Check that struct tags are well aligned.

title: tagliatelle
description: Checks the struct tags.

title: testableexamples
description: Linter checks if examples are testable (have an expected output).

title: testifylint
description: Checks usage of github.com/stretchr/testify.

title: testpackage
description: Linter that makes you use a separate _test package.

title: thelper
description: Thelper detects tests helpers which do not start with the t.Helper() method.

title: tparallel
description: Tparallel detects inappropriate usage of t.Parallel() method in your Go test codes.

title: unconvert
description: Remove unnecessary type conversions.

title: unparam
description: Reports unused function parameters.

title: unqueryvet
description: Detects SELECT * in SQL queries and SQL builders, preventing performance issues and encouraging explicit column selection.

title: unused
description: Checks Go code for unused constants, variables, functions and types.

title: usestdlibvars
description: A linter that detect the possibility to use variables/constants from the Go standard library.

title: usetesting
description: Reports uses of functions with replacement inside the testing package.

title: varnamelen
description: Checks that the length of a variable's name matches its scope.

title: wastedassign
description: Finds wasted assignment statements.

title: whitespace
description: Whitespace is a linter that checks for unnecessary newlines at the start and end of functions, if, for, etc.

title: wrapcheck
description: Checks that errors returned from external packages are wrapped.

title: wsl_v5
description: Add or remove empty lines.

title: zerologlint
description: Detects the wrong usage of `zerolog` that a user forgets to dispatch with `Send` or `Msg`.
